meanings.definition: Having the same relation, relative position, or structure
meanings.sent1: The twins had homologous smiles, showing their shared joy.
meanings.sent2: The two buildings had homologous windows on each floor.
meanings.sent3: The homologous hats worn by the clowns made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was homologous to a sturdy bridge connecting two lands.
meanings.sent5: The homologous patterns on the wallpaper created a sense of harmony in the room.

meanings.definition: Corresponding or similar in position, value, structure, or function
meanings.sent1: The homologous keys fit perfectly in both locks.
meanings.sent2: The homologous genes in siblings can lead to similar traits.
meanings.sent3: The homologous dance moves of the duo amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her words and actions were homologous, showing her integrity.
meanings.sent5: The homologous melodies in the song intertwined beautifully, creating a harmonious blend.
